ygData.subject: RE: Talies is retired....
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, I hate to see you stop playing. Unrest and MM are not great places for a 22 bard.  Unrest is great at 26 thru 30 in a good group (2 tanks, caster and a
ygData.messageBody:
Well, I hate to see you stop playing. Unrest and MM are not great places for
a 22 bard. Unrest is great at 26 thru 30 in a good group (2 tanks, caster
and a good cleric (29+). MM I do not know at all.

Now...South Karana and the aviaks - that is a good place for a 22 bard and
ad hoc groups are not so bad and you can escape a bad fite. Also, HighKeep
during the week is pretty good too - you can fite in groups although you may
need to be on a 20 or 30 minute waiting list to get in. Escape is a bit
harder in Keep but possible.

You and your druid friend could partner - kite (snare, dot, he pulls, you
chase and wince & whack 'em) for 10 levels. Usually always plenty of birds
- wide open spaces and some "fighting music" if you are under the trees.
Close to the Lake Rathe Zone and nite time gnoll camp for loots.

Sylly Songsynger
<Spirit of the Moon>
Bard of the 35th song
somewhere on Innoruuk


-----Original Message-----
From: Talies the Wanderer [mailto:snicker@...]
Sent: Friday, October 29, 1999 8:00 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: [eqbards] Talies is retired....

From: Talies the Wanderer <snicker@...>

At 08:59 AM 10/29/99 -1000, you wrote:
>From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4"
<g4mntofcr@...>
>
>So does that mean you've quit playing EQ or you have
retired from your RL
>job? Not good if its #1, congrats if its #2.

Actually, the first. It's unfortunate, but after spending
the last 2 weeks
gaining a half a bubble slowly over several hours, only to
lose it in an
instant at LEAST 6 times a day - I just got too frustrated.
